item.title: Black Ops 6 & Warzone: How To Unlock All Bo Staff Camos
item.description:
Season 2 Reloaded has officially debuted for Black Ops 6 and Warzone , and while additional maps like Bullet create exciting gameplay moments, much of the attention is focused on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles crossover. In addition to featuring its own dedicated Event Pass with unique rewards, this highly anticipated crossover also brings with it some iconic TMNT melee weapons that many fans will instantly recognize.

Among the melee weapons introduced in Season 2 Reloaded, the Bo Staff stands out as one of the more unexpected additions. Like other melee weapons, it delivers consistent one-hit kills, but it offers increased range at the cost of a slightly slower attack speed. While unlocking the weapon itself is fairly straightforward, acquiring its camos will require players to grind through a series of challenges. Hereâ€™s a full breakdown of every Bo Staff camo and how to unlock them.

All Black Ops 6 Multiplayer Bo Staff Camos

Multiplayer Military Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Granite

  • Get 5 kills using the Bo Staff

Woodland

  • Get 10 kills using the Bo Staff

Savana

  • Get 15 kills using the Bo Staff

Splinter

  • Get 20 kills using the Bo Staff

Moss

  • Get 30 kills using the Bo Staff

Saboteur

  • Get 40 kills using the Bo Staff

Digital

  • Get 50 kills using the Bo Staff

Tide

  • Get 75 kills using the Bo Staff

Red Tiger

  • Get 100 kills using the Bo Staff

Multiplayer Special Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Havoc

  • Unlock every Multiplayer Military Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 50 kills with the Bo Staff while the Strategist Combat Specialty is active

Legacy

  • Unlock every Multiplayer Military Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 5 kills with the Bo Staff in a single match 3 times

Multiplayer Mastery Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Gold

  • Unlock every Multiplayer Special Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 10 double kills with the Bo Staff or better

Diamond

  • Get Gold on the Bo Staff
  • Get Gold on 2 Melee Weapons
  • Get 3 kills with the Bo Staff without dying 10 times

Dark Spine

  • Get Diamond on the Bo Staff
  • Get Diamond on 33 weapons
  • Get 3 triple kills with the Bo Staff or better

Dark Matter

  • Get Dark Spine on the Bo Staff
  • Get Dark Spine on 33 weapons
  • Get 5 kills with the Bo Staff without dying 3 times

All Black Ops 6 Zombies Bo Staff Camos

Zombies Military Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Slate

  • Get 100 kills using the Bo Staff

Desert

  • Get 200 kills using the Bo Staff

Evergreen

  • Get 300 kills using the Bo Staff

Rugged

  • Get 400 kills using the Bo Staff

Grim

  • Get 600 kills using the Bo Staff

Stripe

  • Get 800 kills using the Bo Staff

Oceanic

  • Get 1,000 kills using the Bo Staff

Whiteout

  • Get 1,500 kills using the Bo Staff

Purple Tiger

  • Get 2,000 kills using the Bo Staff

Zombies Special Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Destruction

  • Unlock every Zombies Military Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 300 eliminations with the Bo Staff whilst the Dead Wire Ammo Mod is equipped

Heirloom

  • Unlock every Zombies Military Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Kill 30 Parasites with the Bo Staff

Zombies Mastery Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Mystic Gold

  • Unlock every Zombies Special Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 10 kills rapidly using the Bo Staff 15 times

Opal

  • Get Mystic Gold on the Bo Staff
  • Get Mystic Gold on 2 Melee Weapons
  • Get 30 Special Zombies eliminations with the Bo Staff

Afterlife

  • Get Opal on the Bo Staff
  • Get Opal on 33 weapons
  • Get 20 or more consecutive kills without taking damage 10 times with the Bo Staff

Nebula

  • Get Afterlife on the Bo Staff
  • Get Afterlife on 33 weapons
  • Get 10 Elite Zombie eliminations with the Bo Staff

All Warzone Bo Staff Camos

All Warzone Military Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Quartz

  • Get 5 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Tundra

  • Get 10 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Canyon

  • Get 15 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Pine

  • Get 20 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Undergrowth

  • Get 30 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Snakeskin

  • Get 40 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Siberia

  • Get 50 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Smolder

  • Get 75 eliminations using the Bo Staff

Blue Tiger

  • Get 200 eliminations using the Bo Staff

All Warzone Special Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Frenzy

  • Unlock every Warzone Military Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 5 kills with the Bo Staff shortly after sprinting

Lineage

  • Unlock every Warzone Military Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 5 kills with the Bo Staff while being under an enemy UAV

All Warzone Mastery Camos

Camo

How To Unlock

Gold Tiger

  • Unlock every Warzone Special Camo for the Bo Staff
  • Get 3 eliminations using the Bo Staff whilst being the Most Wanted Contract target

King's Ransom

  • Get Gold Tiger on the Bo Staff
  • Get Gold Tiger on 2 Melee Weapons
  • Get 3 kills with the Bo Staff without dying 2 times

Catalyst

  • Get King's Ransom on the Bo Staff
  • Get King's Ransom on 33 weapons
  • Kill 3 enemies with the Bo Staff that are under the effects of your Concussion Grenade, Flashbang, or Shock Charge

Abyss

  • Get Catalyst on the Bo Staff
  • Get Catalyst on 33 weapons
  • Get 5 kills with the Bo Staff without dying

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases New Way to Get Five-Star Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • A new Honkai: Star Rail leak is teasing a special shop for players to obtain five-star characters within the game.
  • Players will earn currency for the shop after pulling extra copies of characters with maxed-out Eidolons, needing 2 tokens to obtain a character.
  • The five-star character shop will join two new character, free login rewards, and more as part of Star Rail's 2nd anniversary celebrations.

A recent leak from Honkai: Star Rail is hinting at a brand-new way players will be able to pick up five-star characters, though it will require a steep investment. The sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse has typically locked its highest-rarity characters behind the game's gacha system, though some special events have given out free units to fans. HoYoverse first gave out a free five-star character during the Version 1.6 update, with players receiving a free copy of new character Dr. Ratio. Now, fans may have another elusive way to pick up five-star roster members.

While five-star characters are often few and far-between from the gacha system, Honkai: Star Rail does offer some guarantees for players to pick up valuable units. The game's "pity system" guarantees players will obtain a five-star unit every 90 pulls on the gacha, with the featured unit being guaranteed at a minimum of every 180 pulls. Players can also choose a free five-star unit from the standard rotation after their 300th pull on the permanent gacha banner. A rumored new system will look to benefit players obtaining extra five-star units.

Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases New Five-Star Character Shop

A new leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Sakura Haven is hinting at a new system for players to obtain five-star characters. According to the leak, the new system will benefit players pulling extra copies of maxed-out characters, granting a special currency to players pulling copies of characters already at E6. The currency will be used in a special shop, using 2 of the new tokens to choose a five-star unit from a limited selection of characters. The new currency and special five-star unit shop are expected to launch with Version 3.2, currently scheduled to release on April 8.

The new Honkai: Star Rail system will likely see limited applications from many players early on, only granting the special currency after completely maxing out the most valuable units. The currency will more likely see use from players who "miss the 50/50" fairly often, accruing extra copies of the game's standard rotation of characters. The leak does also tease a similar system for Light Cones, with currency obtained from the premium Battle Pass and "alternative methods" and used at a 4-to-1 ratio.

Honkai: Star Rail 's new five-star character system looks to join a plethora of new content coming to celebrate the game's second anniversary. Castorice and Anaxa will debut as Version 3.2's pair of new characters, with special login rewards said to grant up to 30 pulls on the gacha banner throughout the patch. Recent leaks have also teased a potential new "chimera" Pet companion coming to Honkai: Star Rail , based on the chimeras found throughout Amphoreus. Star Rail is set to ring in its third year with a bang with plenty on the way to end Year 2.

item.title: Days Gone Remastered's Release Date is Cutting it Close to Another Remastered PlayStation Release
item.description:
As part of the February 2025 PlayStation State of Play, viewers were treated to the surprise announcement of Days Gone Remastered , an update to the latest game by Bend Studio. Coming to Steam and the Epic Games Store day-and-date with the PS4 upgrade and PS5 launch, players can assume the role of the motorbike-riding Deacon St. John in his definitive adventure once Days Gone Remastered releases on April 25, 2025. While it may not be the most exciting first-party Sony release for the first half of the year, it's at least a good sign for Bend Studio and the Days Gone IP.

Aside from the benefits of a native PS5 version, like improved visual fidelity and DualSense support, Days Gone Remastered has new features to hook players in. Sonyâ€™s touted first-party accessibility suite is a big one, while Horde Assault, a survival arcade mode with its own progression, offers a new way to experience Days Gone . Permadeath and Speedrun modes will allow veterans to show off their skills, while an Enhanced Photo Mode can show the game off in its best light. It's quite the package for diehard fans, and for anyone who has been on the fence about the title, but another PlayStation game may end up stealing the spotlight.

Days Gone Has Been On A Losing Streak To The Last of Us

Among Sonyâ€™s IPs, The Last of Us Is Hard To Top

Days Gone is neither the first nor the most popular zombie-centric, first-party franchise in PlayStation's catalog, and that fact could be about to bite it again. The Last of Us has been one of Naughty Dogâ€™s most successful series since its launch on the PS3, and it's managed to sell over 37 million copies worldwide and kick off a successful TV show. It bears noting that The Last of Us only technically consists of two games because the first was remade into The Last of Us Part 1 , and The Last of Us Part 2 was remastered for PS5 back in January 2024.

That brings the view back to the present, and The Last of Us isn't finished yet. On top of a second season for the TLoU show, which adapts the plot of Part 2 , the PS5 remaster, and the game in general, is finally coming to PC. Come April 3, The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered will join Part 1 on Steam and Epic Games Store. Although the PC port of Part 1 launched with some severe technical issues, hopefully what was learned from that situation will help the sequel avoid them. What it's not avoiding is stepping on its fellow PlayStation IPâ€™s toes.

TLoU Part 2 Remasteredâ€™s PC Launch Could Seriously Harm Days Gone

Although Days Gone has already been on Steam and EGS since 2021, having been an early first-party PlayStation migrant to the PC, its Remastered update could be Days Gone â€™s last shot at the spotlight, and The Last of Us could be getting in the way. TLoS and Days Gone are Sonyâ€™s two big zombie game franchises, and players may opt for one over the other. Chances are good that The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered will undercut Days Gone Remastered , even though the latter will launch on more platforms.

Days Gone Has The Most To Lose From Launching Near Competition

The attention Days Gone could lose to a similar game is important. Neither Days Gone Remastered nor TLoU Part 2 Remastered are coming cheap, and even though they're in the same $50 USD price range, someone who purchases, or even consciously turns down, The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered at the beginning of April may not save up for Days Gone at the end of the month. Days Gone Remastered is launching in a danger zone, but hopefully it can make the best of the hand it's been dealt.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Confirms Steam Feature
item.description:
Summary

  • Ubisoft confirms Assassin's Creed Shadows will launch with Steam achievements on March 20.
  • Pre-orders for the game show strong numbers, indicating a significant market.
  • Players can expect a return to classic Assassin's Creed mechanics with added RPG elements.

Ubisoft has confirmed that Assassin's Creed Shadows will launch with Steam achievements on day one when it comes out on March 20, giving fans a chance to start earning them and padding out their profiles. The list of achievements is already visible on the game's Steam store page, many of which involve finishing story missions and completing basic combat and stealth tasks throughout the player's journey in Assassin's Creed Shadows.

The newest entry in the Assassin's Creed franchise has a lot riding on it as Ubisoft undergoes a huge shift in its priorities following a string of financial upsets and major game shutdowns like XDefiant that have left the company in some turmoil. Fortunately for the developer, pre-orders for Assassin's Creed Shadows appear to be showing strong numbers in early reporting, demonstrating a significant market for the game.

Now, the official Assassin's Creed Twitter account has posted an update announcing to fans that the game will have a full list of Steam achievements that players can earn the day the game launches on March 20. The post included a link to a discussion thread on the game's Steam store page that lists all 54 achievements for the game.

Assassin's Creed Shadows Will Launch With Steam Achievements

While the post made no mention of what the trophies and achievements on the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S versions of the game might look like, they will likely have exactly the same requirements for players who wish to complete the game. Additionally, previous Assassin's Creed games have often brought more achievements alongside the launch of follow-up DLC expansions that often come out post-launch, so fans will likely have even more to earn in the future.

In any case, Assassin's Creed Shadows may very well be a return to form for the franchise, with multiple fan-favorite mechanics set to come back alongside an apparent overhaul of concepts from recent games. For instance, exploration will reportedly be more player-focused, while combat mechanics like the hidden blade and a larger emphasis on stealth are set to come with it, mixing some of the series' classic staples with its more recent RPG elements.

Assassin's Creed Shadows launches on March 20 for the PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S, putting players in the shoes of master shinobi Naoe or the samurai Yasuke, who each come with their own unique sets of abilities. Fortunately for fans looking to stick to one playstyle, Ubisoft has also confirmed that players can finish most of the game as just one of the two protagonists without much issue.

item.title: Best Tactical Roguelikes For Beginners
item.description:
Summary

  • Tactical roguelikes offer accessible approaches with less punishing mechanics for newcomers.
  • Games like Fights In Tight Spaces blend cards and turn-based tactics for a fun yet strategic experience.
  • Titles like Into The Breach and Shogun Showdown offer forgiving combat encounters and innovative mechanics.

Roguelikes can be a difficult genre to approach for newcomers due to the unforgiving nature of permanent death and an often complex combination of mechanics. This can be especially true of tactical roguelikes, in which mistakes are often swiftly punished.

While tactical combat is a staple of traditional roguelikes, many modern titles have managed to develop a more accessible approach. Games that feature less unforgiving mechanics and easy-to-read hazards can often be less frustrating for newcomers by giving them room to make mistakes.

7 Fights In Tight Spaces

A Turn-Based & Tactical Brawler

  • Platform(s): PC, PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch
  • Released: 2021
  • Developer(s): Ground Shatter
  • Genre: Strategy

Fights In Tight Spaces is an action-packed tactics game that tasks players with playing out turn-based battles using a variety of cards. The game's style, animations, and settings are clearly reminiscent of classic action movies, making each encounter fun to simply watch play out.

The card-based structure combined with the turn-based tactics of its gameplay results in an experience that focuses on methodical strategy over skill. As a result, Fights In Tight Spaces is remarkably accessible, and the close-quarters nature of its encounters combined with the readability of its abstract art style elevates this even further.

6 Cobalt Core

Roguelike Deck-Building & Tactical Space Battles

Cobalt Core is a roguelike deck-builder with a bright and colorful art style that's both charming and approachable. This is supported further by a soothing soundtrack and quirky characters that make the overall presentation entirely welcoming.

The gameplay itself combines roguelike deck-building with turn-based tactics in dynamic space battles that are both strategic and accessible. With an abundance of diverse but easy-to-understand cards and a slowly ramping difficulty, Cobalt Core's combat encounters are able to maintain a solid level of depth while preventing confusion.

5 For The King

Approachable Combat & Tactical Overworld Exploration

For The King is a strategy RPG with a roguelike structure that tasks players with leading a party of three across an overworld map and battling enemies in turn-based combat. With a deeper focus on strategy than tactics, For The King is able to offer remarkably accessible combat, but its overworld exploration remains a tremendously tactical experience.

Players must be careful about the positioning of their heroes on the overworld map and must plan their movements accordingly. The world changes over time, and players must act quickly and tactically if they're to make the most of random events and avoid dangerous foes. Despite this, the game's accessible combat mechanics keep it approachable, and playing in co-op significantly reduces the number of elements players need to juggle.

4 Necroking

A Tactical Autobattler

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2024
  • Developer(s): Alawar
  • Genre: Tactics

Necroking is a minimalist combination of real-time tactics and auto-battling with roguelite elements. In the game, players explore a grid-based overworld and take part in tactical battles, strategically summoning units to different sections of the battlefield in order to succeed.

The simple exploration of the overworld and lack of constant control over the combat encounters ensures Necroking is an accessible experience. However, the intuitive summoning system and deck-building elements ensure the player always has both tactical and strategic decisions to make.

3 Into The Breach

Turn-Based Tactics With A Forgiving Structure

Into The Breach isn't necessarily an easy game, but its innovative approach to enemy telegraphing and puzzle-based game design makes it perfect for beginners. More specifically, each combat encounter in Into The Breach is incredibly easy to read, as all the necessary information is given to the player freely.

These combat encounters are made all the more accessible via the addition of an undo button and the ability to reset entire turns when things go awry. Furthermore, Into The Breach tasks players with controlling just three units in its turn-based battles, ensuring players never have too much to manage at once.

2 Tinyfolks

A Short & Easy-To-Learn Tactical RPG

With its minimalist pixel-art graphics, short play-time, and focus on threat assessment over tactical positioning, Tinyfolks is a great introductory experience for newcomers to the genre. Tasking players with assembling a party of unique classes and commanding them through tight combat gauntlets, Tinyfolks excels with its simple turn-based combat and risk-reward structure.

In the game, players are tasked with defeating a variety of unique dungeons with their own enemy types and bosses. Similarly to games such as Darkest Dungeon , Tinyfolks blends this turn-based combat with management mechanics. However, this title simplifies the dungeon-crawling aspect by removing exploration from the gameplay, and, unlike Darkest Dungeon , players need not worry about their adventurers having heart attacks.

1 Shogun Showdown

Combat-Heavy Roguelike Tactics

Shogun Showdown is a turn-based roguelike that feels like an action game played out in slow motion. This is thanks to its intuitive and innovative combat system that tasks players with simple tiles to maneuver along a single axis, taking out enemies while avoiding incoming damage.

The focus on careful positioning and the overarching strategy brought in by the deck-building elements allows Shogun Showdown to be a deeply tactical experience. However, its simple controls and lack of overly complex mechanics keep it from being inaccessible.
